ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would say that this course is a good introduction to the use of math in biology, but would stop short of recommending it to someone without at least some knowledge of math beyond introductory calculus. The applications in biology were clear, but I think the actual math got short shrift.
I think it is really beneficial. However, if someone already has a good training in basic maths contents, auditing some part of the lecture could be a more efficient choice.
A good introduction to a broad spectrum of math techniques that can be used in biological research.

It is a class that involves a survey of introductory Mathematical concepts in Statistics, Linear Algebra, Differential equations and Fourier Transform. I would recommend this class for a fellow student if s/he will need these mathematical concepts in his/her future research/career. However, if one expects to learn anything about MATLAB, s/he should not take this class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learnt how to work on matlab from this course. This is really helpful and providing me with a whole world of computing biology.
I think this course is helpful in terms of the mathematical concepts taught but it is not helpful in the computational part.
